conclusion: To determine where the liquid will flow after passing through baffles, I will analyze the layout of the containers and the flow path shown in the image. This involves understanding the direction in which liquid moves through the system.

The image shows a series of containers connected by channels. At the top, there are four containers labeled A, B, C, and D, from which liquid will flow out. These containers are connected by channels that lead downward. Below, there are two containers labeled E and F, each connected by channels to the lower parts of the system. Baffles are present, directing the flow of liquid between the containers.

premise: The liquid from containers A, B, C, and D will flow through channels towards the lower section of the system.
conclusion: Observing the flow path, the liquid from A and B moves leftward, while the liquid from C and D moves rightward.

premise: The channels leading to E are positioned such that they receive liquid from A and B, while F receives liquid from C and D.
conclusion: Since E is positioned to the left of the system and F to the right, and given the direction of flow, it is evident that the liquid from A and B will flow into E, and the liquid from C and D will flow into F.
